Peter, you could use any version of HyperNEAT currently available for you=
r task, but the main question is whether the geometry (or regularities) of =
the time series can somehow be made an advantage to HyperNEAT through the c=
onfiguration of the substrate.  It is not immediately clear why HyperNEAT i=
n particular is advantageous for time series problems, though it is possibl=
e it can be leveraged in some way that is helpful.  

As an alternative, yo=
u could also try regular NEAT as well.  Also, if you search through the arc=
hives of this group you will find a number of discussions on time series pr=
ediction.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Peter" <blackprinzze@...> wro=
te:
>
> Hi
> 
> I'm currently trying to develop HyperNEAT for Time series f=
orecasting (Stock & commodity)
> 
> 1, Is there a current version of HyperN=
EAT available that my be suited for this task?
> 
> 2, If not can you pleas=
e point me in the right direction, explaining  how this can be achieved. 
>=
 
> 3, Forecast should behave, similar to that of a Moving average, with fo=
recast plots one period or more into the future. 
> 
> Thanks
> 
> Peter
>
=
